Title: "The Art of Deception" by David J. Smith

"The Art of Deception" is a detective novel that centers around insurance fraud. The protagonist, Sam Porter, is a former insurance investigator with a deep understanding of the industry's inner workings. He's now a private investigator, specializing in cases related to insurance fraud.

In this novel, Sam is hired by a wealthy client to investigate a series of fraudulent claims against her late husband's insurance policies. As Sam delves deeper into the case, he uncovers a complex web of deceit that leads him from the glamorous world of London's art scene to the underbelly of the city, where organized crime and corrupt businessmen lurk.

As Sam gets closer to the truth, he finds himself in grave danger. He must navigate a maze of clues, follow a trail of fake artifacts, and outwit the ruthless criminals determined to silence him permanently. With his life and the future of his business on the line, Sam will stop at nothing to solve the case and bring the guilty to justice.

This novel combines intricate plotting, vivid characterization, and a deep understanding of the intricacies of insurance fraud, making it an engaging read for fans of detective fiction.
